item.title: Alan add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Hatred is the coward's revenge for being intimidated." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Alan add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "The real hero is always a hero by mistake; he dreams of being an honest coward like everybody else." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Alan add a quote by Mickey Mantle
item.description: "A team is where a boy can prove his courage on his own. A gang is where a coward goes to hide." -- Mickey Mantle

item.title: Alan add a quote by José Rizal
item.description: "Cowardice rightly understood begins with selfishness and ends with shame." -- José Rizal

item.title: Alan add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "When the sands are all dry, he is gay as a lark, And will talk in contemptuous tones of the Shark: But, when the tide rises and sharks are around, His voice has a timid and tremulous sound." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Alan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Most civilisation is based on cowardice. It's so easy to civilize by teaching cowardice. You water down the standards which would lead to bravery. You restrain the will. You regulate the appetites. You fence in the horizons. You make a law for every movement. You deny the existence of chaos. You teach even the children to breathe slowly. You tame." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Alan add a quote by Walter Karp
item.description: "[The public school system is] usually a twelve year sentence of mind control. Crushing creativity, smashing individualism, encouraging collectivism and compromise, destroying the exercise of intellectual inquiry, twisting it instead into meek subservience to authority." -- Walter Karp

item.title: Alan add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Alan add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Alan add a quote by G. K. Chesterton
item.description: "The word "good" has many meanings. For example, if a man were to shoot his grandmother at a range of five hundred yards, I should call him a good shot, but not necessarily a good man." -- G. K. Chesterton
